question: An organization relies on online seasonal sales for the majority of it's annual revenue. Why should the organization use App Engine for their customer app?

A.answer: Automatically adjusts physical inventory in real time

D.answer: Recommends the right products to customers

question: An organization is using machine learning to make predictions. One of their datasets mistakenly includes mislabeled data. How will the prediction be impacted?

A global organization is developing an application to manage payments and online bank accounts in multiple regions. Each transaction must be handled consistently in their database, and they anticipate almost unlimited growth in the amount of data stored. Which Google Cloud product should the organization choose?

An organization has servers running mission-critical workloads on-premises around the world. They want to modernize their infrastructure with a multi-cloud architecture. What benefit cloud the organization experience?

A.answer: Ability to disable regional network connectivity during cyber attacks

B.answer: Ability to keep backups of their data on-premises in case of failure

C.answer: Full management access to their regional infrastructure

D.answer: Reduced likelihood of system failure during high-demand events

question: An organization needs to run frequent updates for it's business app. Why should the organization use Google Kubernetes (GKE)?

A.answer: Customer expectations can be adjusted without using marketing tools

B.answer: Seamless changes can be made without causing any application downtime

C.answer: GKE handles version control seamlessly and out of the box

D.answer: GKE is well-suited for all monolithic applications

question: An organization wants to use Apigee to manage all it's application programming interfaces (APIs). What will Apigee enable the organization to do?
An e-commerce organization is reviewing it's cloud data storage. What type of raw data can they store in a relational database without any processing?
A hotel wants to modernize it's legacy systems so that customers can make reservations through a mobile app. What's the benefit of using an application programming interface (API) to do this?

A.answer: They do not have to develop the end-user application

B.answer: They can deprecate their legacy systems

C.answer: They can transform their systems to be cloud-native

D.answer: They do not have to rewrite the legacy system

question: An organization wants to digitize and share large volumes of historical text and images. Why is a public cloud a better option than an on-premises solution?

An organization wants to develop an application that can be personalized to user preferences throughout the year. Why should they build a cloud-native application instead of modernizing their existing on-premises application?

A.answer: Developers can rely on the cloud provider for all source code

B.answer: Developers can launch new features in an agile way

C.answer: IT managers can migrate existing application archirecture without nedding updates

D.answer: IT managers can accelerate capital expenditure planning
